Package com.gemalto.idp.mobile.ui.secureinput

Class EncryptedData

java.lang.Object
com.gemalto.idp.mobile.ui.secureinput.EncryptedData
public class EncryptedData extends Object
This class holds the Secure Keypad encrypted result when it is used in encrypted mode with the SecureKeypadListenerEncrypted listener. A EncryptedData object is passed in the SecureKeypadListenerEncrypted.onFinish(EncryptedData) callback when the user tap on the OK button.

Encryption Mode = GEMALTO:

EncryptedData object contains all the encrypted key blobs entered in the input field #1 and input field #2 (optional) and it also contains the final verification datagram.

Encryption Mode = GEMALTO_SHA256:

EncryptedData object contains all the encrypted key blobs entered in the input field #1 and input field #2 (optional) and it also contains the final verification datagram. The encryption is done using RSA with OAEP padding (using SHA-256).

Encryption Mode = ISO_9564_1_AES or ISO_9564_1_3DES:

EncryptedData object contains the encrypted PIN and encrypted symmetric key in the input field #1 in this order. Input field #2 and verification datagram are null.

Since:
6.2

  • Constructor Details

    • EncryptedData

      public EncryptedData(int version, List<byte[]> keyBlobList1, List<byte[]> keyBlobList2, byte[] verificationDatagram)
      Constructor of EncryptedData object. This is used by the secure keypad to build the object returned in SecureKeypadListenerEncrypted.onFinish(EncryptedData) when it is used in encrypted mode.
      Parameters:
      version - Version number of encrypted data.
      keyBlobList1 - List of encrypted key blobs for input field #1.
      keyBlobList2 - List of encrypted key blobs for input field #2.
      verificationDatagram - Final verification datagram.
      Since:
      6.2

  • Method Details

    • getVersion

      public int getVersion()
      Returns the version of the EncryptedData version.
      Returns:
      EncryptedData object version.

      "1" for GEMALTO encryption mode.

      "2" for ISO_9564_1_AES encryption mode.

      "3" for ISO_9564_1_3DES encryption mode.

      "4" for GEMALTO_SHA256 encryption mode.

      Since:
      6.2

    • getField1

      public List<byte[]> getField1()
      Returns the List of encrypted key blobs for input field #1. Can be null if the user cancel the secure keypad.
      Returns:
      List of encrypted key blobs.

      Note:

      Encryption Mode = GEMALTO:

      Each key blob contains the 4 bytes UTF-32 (Big-Endian) value of corresponding key character displayed on the keypad. Each key blob is encrypted with RSA public key used to initialize the secure keypad.

      Encryption Mode = GEMALTO_SHA256:

      Each key blob contains the 4 bytes UTF-32 (Big-Endian) value of corresponding key character displayed on the keypad. Each key blob is encrypted with RSA public key (OAEP padding with SHA-256) used to initialize the secure keypad.

      Encryption Mode = ISO_9564_1_AES:

      First key blob contains PIN with ISO 9564 Format 1, encrypted with AES key (PKCS#5 padding).

      Second key blob contains symmetric key encrypted with RSA public key (OAEP padding).

      Encryption Mode = ISO_9564_1_3DES:

      First key blob contains PIN with ISO 9564 Format 1, encrypted with 3DES key (No padding).

      Second key blob contains symmetric key encrypted with RSA public key (OAEP padding).

      Since:
      6.2

    • getField2

      public List<byte[]> getField2()
      Returns the List of encrypted key blobs for input field #2. Can be null if the keypad is used in single entry mode.
      Returns:
      List of encrypted key blobs.

      Note:

      Encryption Mode = GEMALTO:

      Each key blob contains the 4 bytes UTF-32 (Big-Endian) value of corresponding key character displayed on the keypad. Each key blob is encrypted with RSA public key used to initialize the secure keypad.

      Encryption Mode = GEMALTO_SHA256:

      Each key blob contains the 4 bytes UTF-32 (Big-Endian) value of corresponding key character displayed on the keypad. Each key blob is encrypted with RSA public key (OAEP padding with SHA-256) used to initialize the secure keypad. Can be null if the keypad is used in single entry mode.

      Encryption Mode = ISO_9564_1_AES:

      First key blob contains PIN with ISO 9564 Format 1, encrypted with AES key (PKCS#5 padding).

      Second key blob contains symmetric key encrypted with RSA public key (OAEP padding).

      Encryption Mode = ISO_9564_1_3DES:

      First key blob contains PIN with ISO 9564 Format 1, encrypted with 3DES key (No padding).

      Second key blob contains symmetric key encrypted with RSA public key (OAEP padding).

      Since:
      6.2

    • getVerificationDatagram

      public byte[] getVerificationDatagram()
      Returns the final verification datagram.
      Returns:
      Final verification datagram.

      Note: Encryption Mode = GEMALTO:

      The verification datagram contains 5 fields in the following order and meaning: 

       [ 1 byte  |   2 bytes    | UserDataSize bytes | 32 bytes |    8 bytes      ]
 [ Version | UserDataSize |      UserData      |  Digest  | EPOCH Timestamp ]

      Version: Unsigned 1 byte integer. The Verification datagram format version.

      UserDataSize: Unsigned 2 byte integer. Size in bytes of UseData field.

      UserData: Byte Array of UserDataSize Bytes. Opaque data provided by the integrator. It's mandatory, and the size should be between 1 and UserDataMaxSize (See below).

      Digest: Byte Array of 32 Bytes. NIST's TupleHash encoded SHA-256 digest of the result of concatenating all the encrypted digits in the natural order
      (InputField1-Digit1, InputField1-Digit2, ..., InputField1-DigitN, {InputField2-Digit1, InputField2-Digit2, ..., InputField2-DigitN })
      where InputField2 will only be present for double input mode.

      EPOCH Timestamp: Signed 8 byte integer. EPOCH/Unix Timestamp at the Verification Datagram generation.

      The encrypted datagram will also include the RSA-OAEP Padding (EME-OAEP as defined in PKCS #1 v2.0 with SHA-1, MGF1 and an empty encoding parameter). It should be automatically removed by the RSA decryption algorithm.

      All integers are stored using Network Byte Order.

      UserDataMaxSize for standard RSA Key lengths supported by GMST: 
       [ RSA KeySize (Modulus bits) | KeySize (In Bytes) | UserDataMaxSize (In Bytes) ]
 [            2048            |         256        |             171            ]
 [            4096            |         512        |             427            ]
 [            8192            |        1024        |             939            ]
      For other RSA Key Sizes, UserDataMaxSize is generally computed as KeySize (In Bytes) - 85 Bytes.

      Encryption Mode = GEMALTO_SHA256:

      The verification datagram is same as GEMALTO mode but it is encrypted using RSA with OAEP padding (using SHA-256).

      Encryption Mode = ISO_9564_1_AES or ISO_9564_1_3DES:

      Always null.

      Since:
      6.2

    • wipe

      public void wipe()
      Wipes the EncryptedData object.
      Since:
      6.2
